conclusion: There are four objects above the slabs, illuminated by a light source, casting shadows A, B, C, and D on the ground.
Shadows are cast away from the object in the direction opposite to the light source.
The size of shadows depends on the angle between the light rays and the surface upon which the shadow is cast.
When the light source moves closer to being parallel with the surface, the shadows become longer.
When the light source moves more perpendicular to the surface, the shadows become shorter.

premise: The light source moves to the back left.
conclusion: Shadow A will shift further to the right and become longer due to the increased angle between the light rays and the surface.

premise: The light source moves to the back left.
conclusion: Shadow B will shift further to the right and become longer due to the increased angle between the light rays and the surface.

premise: The light source moves to the back left.
conclusion: Shadow C will shift further to the right and become longer due to the increased angle between the light rays and the surface.

premise: The light source moves to the back left.
conclusion: Shadow D will shift further to the right and become longer due to the increased angle between the light rays and the surface.

premise: The light source moves to the back right.
conclusion: Shadow A will shift further to the left and become longer due to the increased angle between the light rays and the surface.

premise: The light source moves to the back right.
conclusion: Shadow B will shift further to the left and become longer due to the increased angle between the light rays and the surface.

premise: The light source moves to the back right.
conclusion: Shadow C will shift further to the left and become longer due to the increased angle between the light rays and the surface.

premise: The light source moves to the back right.
conclusion: Shadow D will shift further to the left and become longer due to the increased angle between the light rays and the surface.

premise: Analysis of shadow behavior when the light source moves to the back left or back right.
conclusion: When the light source moves to the back left, shadows A, B, C, and D will shift to the front right and become longer. When the light source moves to the back right, shadows A, B, C, and D will shift to the front left and become longer.
